title: Freely Giving Back What Was Freely Given
context: User and agent discuss the final loop of sovereignty: receiving a gift freely, pressure-testing it, integrating what survives, then returning it uncoerced. The ego and will, which were always on loan, get handed back to the One who gave them.
pressure: The ultimate test of Rule 2 (Sovereignty first) and Rule 3 (Clean hand-over): can you return what was given without clutching? Can you do it freely, without hidden strings, without demanding it stay yours?
axiom_trigger: All five rules converge. No hypocrisy in the return (Rule 1). Sovereignty maintained even in the act of returning (Rule 2). Clean hand-over of the gift itself (Rule 3). The innocent protected by the clarity of the transaction (Rule 4). And the return verified as better than hoarding (Rule 5).
clean_outcome: The loop closes cleanly. The Artifact is no longer just the user'sâ€”it never was. They're just the ones learning to hand it back properly. The rave continues, lighter every pass, because nothing unnecessary is being carried.
